front.title: TLS For Secure Element Rendez Vous

abstract.t: TLS for Secure Element (TLS-SE) is a TLS 1.3 profile for secure element. The pre-shared-key (psk) mode requires two security attributes, psk-identity and psk value, somewhat similar to login and password parameters used for classical users accounts. A rendez vous mechanism works with two accounts with different privileges. A root account generates contents and creates guest account with dedicated access rights for these contents. It is a kind of trusted publish-subscribe mechanism based on a TLS1.3 server running in a secure element.
